name: Nur Islamic School of Louisville
mission:
Our Mission
Our holistic education aims to provide the environment for the total and balanced development of every student in every sphere of learning –...
theoryOfChange: Providing a holistic environment that balances spiritual, moral, and intellectual development leads to students attaining a conscious relationship with God and becoming contributing members of society.

evaluationSources: Certified by the state of Kentucky

zakatClaimEvidence: The official website and donation pages of Nur Islamic School of Louisville do not explicitly mention accepting zakat donations or having dedicated zakat funds. Donation options are presented for general financial aid and continuous sadaqa jariyah.

strengths.detail: The school directs <cite id="7">1.0% of its expenses toward program services</cite>, ensuring that donor funds are utilized entirely for educational delivery.
The organization has achieved a <cite id="6">3-year revenue CAGR of 29.0%</cite>, growing from $1.68 million in 2021 to <cite id="5">$2.79 million in 2023</cite>.
The institution maintains <cite id="9">12.2 months of working capital</cite>, providing a significant safety net for sustained operations.

strengths_deep_dive: Nur Islamic School of Louisville exhibits a high degree of financial health and transparency in its resource allocation. With <cite id="10">100% independent board members</cite> and a perfect <cite id="7">100.0% program expense ratio</cite>, the school ensures that its <cite id="11">$2.79 million budget</cite> is focused on its core mission of holistic education. The institution's ability to maintain <cite id="8">zero fundraising costs</cite> while achieving double-digit revenue growth highlights a sustainable and community-supported financial model.
rich_narrative.summary: Founded in <cite id="1">1999</cite>, the Nur Islamic School of Louisville is a private academic institution dedicated to providing a <cite id="2">holistic educational environment</cite> for students from early childhood through grade 12. The school integrates <cite id="3">divine revelation with rational and intellectual knowledge</cite>, focusing on the balanced development of students in every sphere of learning. Based in Louisville, Kentucky, the organization manages a comprehensive curriculum that includes <cite id="4">Quran, Arabic, and Islamic Studies</cite> alongside standard Language Arts and Social Studies. Financially, the institution demonstrates significant growth, reporting <cite id="5">$2,796,768 in total revenue</cite> for the 2023 tax year, representing a <cite id="6">3-year revenue CAGR of 29.0%</cite>. The school operates with remarkable financial efficiency, maintaining a <cite id="7">100.0% program expense ratio</cite>, which indicates that all reported expenses are directed toward its educational mission. Furthermore, the organization is highly efficient in its resource acquisition, spending <cite id="8">$0.00 to raise every $1</cite> in contributions.
